main_definition: To close or cover something, usually by turning it into a closed position.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To stop talking or making noise.
meanings_and_examples.example: When I'm trying to concentrate on my work, I ask everyone in the room to shut up.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To close a door, window, or other opening.
meanings_and_examples.example: Before going to bed, make sure all the windows and doors are shut.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cease operating or functioning properly.
meanings_and_examples.example: My computer is acting up; I think it might be time to take a look at what's wrong with it. It seems like something needs to shut down, either hardware-wise or software.
The child shuts his eyes during the scary part of the movie.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In slang, to refuse or decline something.
meanings_and_examples.example: She shook her head and said no, she doesn't want to go out tonight. She shut down the idea right away.
